title: Paul Anleitner, From Charismania to a Better Integrated Participation
description:
Paul is a pastor, teacher, podcaster who's been working the same beat as I have on Jordan Peterson, the Meaning Crisis, etc. I was on his show once and in this he returns the favor. 

We do a deep dive into his story from how the Roman Catholic charismatic movement changed his parents to his own journey through some of the wilder spaces in the Pentecostal scene. In many ways Paul and I are working towards similar goals and so in this long conversation we not only delve into his story but we compare notes. 

Deep Talks: Exploring Theology & Meaning-Making

Podcast
Android/PC/Web:
https://deeptalkstheologypodcast.podbean.com/
Apple Users:
https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/deep-talks-exploring-theology-and-meaning-making/id1401730159

YouTube Channel:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2yCyOMUeem-cYwliC-tLJg

Paul Anleitner Twitter:
https://twitter.com/paulanleitner

Wp Films does films on charismatic movement http://www.wpfilm.com/

Formal education’s collapse
Discord channel

Full on revival hit the school, Toronto blessing, Brownsville Revival

Musical expression of worship was their sacrament

Worship music as a means of communion with God
Parachurch ministry helping churches establish houses of prayer
International House of Prayer in Kansas City

Going through a theological evolution, some deconstruction

Jordan Peterson and Sam Harris
Dwight Hopkins liberation theology
Three domains: spirit, aesthetic (creative expression of spirit) Aesthetic is a portal to spirit, culture as labor

It’s like Jacob’s Ladder, angels ascending and descending
Our values are invisible
Labor and aesthetic are always subordinate to spirit
James KA Smith
Nietzsche
Music as the means of grace
Finger of God Movie

Prosperity gospel and word of faith
Rodney Howard Brown
Kenneth Hagan
Toking the Ghost
God’s just really frugal
